intro: Eriogonum pyrolifolium var. typicum, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. This species is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
